settings.code:
ENGAGEMENT RING EDUCATION

All you need to know about your ring

settings.text: Choosing an engagement ring can be a stressful process. However, it doesn't have to be. By taking a little bit of time to understand all the components of the engagement ring, the decision can be a simpler one. You'll also have a beautiful ring to celebrate your engagement. Learn all about metal, ring styles, diamonds, gemstones, and how to buy an engagement ring in order to make the best decision. You can also start by learning the parts of an engagement ring with our 101 guide so you can get on the right path to the perfect ring for a perfect proposal.

settings.custom_liquid:
ENGAGEMENT RINGS 101

Choosing an engagement ring can be a stressful process. However, it doesn't have to be. By taking a little bit of time to understand all the components of the engagement ring, the decision can be a simpler one. You'll also have a beautiful ring to celebrate your engagement. Learn all about metal, ring styles, diamonds, gemstones, and how to buy an engagement ring in order to make the best decision. You can also start by learning the parts of an engagement ring with our 101 guide so you can get on the right path to the perfect ring for a perfect proposal.

settings.title: Ring Buying Guide
settings.text: Explore our engagement ring shopping guide for expert advice on choosing the perfect style at the perfect price. Ring buying is made easy with these steps.

settings.title: Ring Collection
settings.text: Explore a wide range of ring styles at Stienhardt & Stones. Whether you’re looking for solitaires, halos, classic, contemporary, or three-stone rings, we have something for every taste. Consider the look, budget, and style when selecting your ring. Discover the differences and find the one that suits you best.

settings.title: Ring Sizing
settings.text: You've got it all ready, except the finger size! Follow our printable guide for tips on finding out the size, whether secretively or not. Get it right the first time! We’re happy to create rings in quarter sizes and in-between sizes to ensure we can craft the perfect fit.

settings.title: Setting Styles
settings.text: Even subtle differences matter with engagement rings. Look at the fine detailing of various setting styles up close so you can determine which fits your perfect ring.

settings.title: Head Styles
settings.text: The ring setting's head is particularly important for it holds your center stone. The head is in the spotlight so see the choices up close before choosing a ring style.

settings.title: Buying Online
settings.text: Learn the positives and negatives of buying an engagement ring online. Get tips and additional information to make the right decision with any online jewelry store.

settings.code:
DELIBERATELY DIFFERENT NO. 1

Gemstone ring education

Gemstone rings offer a striking alternative to diamond engagement rings in their hue and color. Choose one for your engagement or to celebrate an occasion.

DELIBERATELY DIFFERENT NO.3

WHAT ARE THE PARTS OF AN ENGAGEMENT RING SETTING?

settings.heading: YELLOW GOLD
settings.description: Want a color that gives off a vintage look? Opt for 18 karat yellow gold for a rich color that channels past generations of engagement rings or go with 14 karat, which imparts a subtle warm glow to your whole ring. Yellow gold is known to even help make lower color grade diamonds appear whiter, making it a savvy choice for getting your ideal ring on a budget.

settings.heading: WHITE GOLD
settings.description: In need of a versatile metal that can be worn daily? We recommend 14 karat white gold, which we coat with rhodium for an extra protective layer. Opt for 18 karat white gold for more durability and a silvery shine similar to platinum. A great compliment to vivid gemstones or sparkly diamonds.

settings.heading: ROSE GOLD
settings.description: Impart a romantic vibe with 14 karat rose gold. For those that want more of a warm gold hue, we recommend 18 karat rose gold. Beautifully paired with contemporary designs and vintage styles, rose gold metal looks best with fancy shaped stones and deeper colored gemstones like ruby.

settings.heading: PLATINUM
settings.description: Did you know platinum is more expensive and rare than gold? Famous for its durability and silvery hue, it is wonderful at resisting scratches and abrasion. This precious metal is ideal for wedding bands and rings that will be worn daily. We recommend white gemstones or colored gemstones that have a cooler hue like blue sapphires.

settings.heading: DELIBERATELY DIFFERENT NO. 2
settings.description: Metal choice can give a completely different feel to your ring. The same style can look like an antique style engagement ring in yellow gold but a modern take on vintage in white gold. But we’re here to help you find the metal that perfectly fits your personal style.

settings.title: CRAFT A RING
settings.text: Crafting a customized ring is easy with With Clarity's shopping experience. Choose any metal, the perfect diamond, and the right ring setting for the ultimate experience.

settings.title: WHERE TO BUY RINGS
settings.text: Customers can shop for engagement rings in-store or online. Let us guide you through the pros and cons or each so you can make your own decision for which suits you best.

settings.title: CHOOSING A JEWELER
settings.text: Choosing the right jeweler is very important. Get objective advice on making the right choice, whether in-store or online. At With Clarity our gemologists get up close and personal with all our gemstones to ensure you get the best one.

Get started

settings.title: How much is the average Engagement Ring?
settings.text: As of 2024, the average cost of an engagement ring in the United States is around $5,500. However, this can vary widely based on factors such as the type of diamond (natural or lab-grown), the quality and size of the diamond, the setting, and the retailer. Lab-grown diamonds, like those offered by Stienhardt & Stones, can often provide a more affordable option without compromising on quality.

settings.title: Can you tell the difference between Lab and Natural Diamonds?
settings.text: Visually, lab-grown diamonds and natural diamonds are nearly indistinguishable to the naked eye. Both types of diamonds exhibit the same physical and chemical properties, including hardness, brilliance, and clarity.

settings.title: What is the best engagement ring setting?
settings.text:
The best engagement ring setting depends on personal preference, lifestyle, and the diamond being used. Here are some popular engagement ring settings, each with its own advantages:

  1. Prong Setting: This classic setting uses metal prongs to hold the diamond in place. It allows maximum light to pass through the diamond, enhancing its brilliance and sparkle. It’s a versatile choice that works well with various diamond shapes.
  2. Pavé Setting: Small diamonds are set closely together along the band, creating a continuous sparkle. This setting adds extra glamour and is ideal for those who want more sparkle without a larger center stone.
  3. Halo Setting: A ring of smaller diamonds surrounds the center stone, making it appear larger and more brilliant. This setting is great for maximizing the visual impact of the center diamond.
  4. Bezel Setting: The diamond is encased in a metal rim that holds it securely. This setting offers excellent protection for the diamond and is a good choice for those with an active lifestyle.
  5. Channel Setting: Diamonds are set in a channel within the band, providing a sleek and modern look. This setting is durable and protects the diamonds from chipping.
  6. Three-Stone Setting: Features a center diamond flanked by two smaller diamonds, symbolizing the past, present, and future. This setting offers a meaningful and elegant design.
  7. Vintage Setting: Inspired by antique designs, these settings often feature intricate details and unique characteristics. They are perfect for those who love a romantic and timeless look.

Ultimately, the best setting is one that suits the wearer’s style and lifestyle, enhances the beauty of the diamond, and offers the desired level of durability and maintenance.

settings.title: What is the thinnest I should make an engagement ring?
settings.text: The thinnest practical width for an engagement ring band is typically around 2 millimeters. This width strikes a balance between durability and comfort, providing enough metal to securely hold the setting while maintaining a delicate and elegant appearance on the finger.
